article_title: Are Out-of-Pocket Medical Costs Too High?
article_text:
Many health-insurance premiums rose again this year, sometimes by double digits. A lot of the increases were accompanied by higher deductibles as well. Insurers say the increases are justified because their costs have risen as more people with health problems have signed up for insurance in the wake of the Affordable Care Act.

Some policy experts see the higher out-of-pocket costs as a positive development. When patients have a...

twitter.description: Lynn Quincy of Consumers Union says people pay too much and skimp on needed care. Grace-Marie Turner of the Galen Institute says high costs give consumers incentive to bring about efficiency.
twitter.title: Are Out-of-Pocket Medical Costs Too High?
